body: I rarely need to do anything like that on arch, but same here. Everyone else seems to just magically know everything and it's like they have all this shared knowledge that I'm not in on. And people like you and me are the few exceptions that have to actually, you know, find out about things before we can know them. There's always all kinds of stuff that's not really documented or taught anywhere yet it seems everyone else just automatically knows it all.

body: Have fun making Fedora use any other init than systemd. It has no business being in the bottom half. Gentoo would be the best fit for the lib-right IMO. And consider LFS for lib-cent. LFS doesn't seem to have a logo though.

body: The distros I currently have are Funtoo and Artix-openrc. Both work for me. Artix-runit was fine too but openrc needs less maintenance and has a supervisor too now. pacman is definitely the best non-source based package manager.

body:
Gday
I was using Gallium OS on my Toshiba Chromebook 2 CB35

Its heading in a bad 'Modern' and 'progressive' direction
along with XFCE project

I swapped from GalliumOS 3.1 to Endeavour OS
I was suprised it worked with N2810 (Bay Tail)

Not the perfect solution as its Arch with SystemD+Pulse
but it will be okay for the current time
body_html:
Gday I was using Gallium OS on my Toshiba Chromebook 2 CB35

Its heading in a bad 'Modern' and 'progressive' direction along with XFCE project

I swapped from GalliumOS 3.1 to Endeavour OS I was suprised it worked with N2810 (Bay Tail)

Not the perfect solution as its Arch with SystemD+Pulse but it will be okay for the current time
